tweet:
As 2019 comes to an end, I want to say THANK YOU again for the honor you’ve given me to serve as representative for Colorado's 1st District. It’s truly a privilege and I hope we’re making you proud.

Take a look at some of the year's highlights: pic.twitter.com/ggKQicBKFo

What a way to end the decade! Congrats to #Broncos running back (and South High alum) Phillip Lindsay on becoming the first undrafted player in NFL history with consecutive 1,000-yard rushing seasons to begin his career. https://denver.cbslocal.com/2019/12/29/phillip-lindsay-record-broncos/ …

Since the moment I arrived in Congress, John Lewis has shown me what it means to be a fighter. Having him as a colleague is a daily privilege. 

I’m sending prayers and love to John and his family as he enters this next battle. 

If anyone can fight this it’s our friend John.

We can’t protect our environment and the public health if we ignore science. The Trump admin’s attack on science must be stopped. https://www.nytimes.com/2019/12/28/climate/trump-administration-war-on-science.html …
Horrified to hear about yet another anti-Semitic attack in our country — this time at the home of a rabbi during Hanukkah. My hearts go out to all those impacted.
From my family to yours, I want to wish everyone a #MerryChristmas. Have a wonderful holiday! pic.twitter.com/awbzGlVpLL

Getting our #Tobacco21 bill across the finish line – to keep dangerous tobacco products out of the hands of young people when they are most at risk of forming a lifelong addiction – has been a top priority for me. So glad to see it finally signed into law. https://time.com/5754266/trump-tobacco-age-21/ …
As we begin the Festival of Lights, I want to wish a #HappyHannukah to all those celebrating in Colorado and around the world.

The Trump admin’s new abortion-billing rule is another shameless attack on our constitutionally-protected right to reproductive care – and could impact abortion coverage for more than 3 million people.
 
This admin’s war on reproductive rights must be stopped! #CoverMyAbortion
At least you got a card…  https://twitter.com/ChrisMurphyCT/status/1207391721539227648 … pic.twitter.com/EHpebz13U1

John Dingell was my mentor and dear friend. He was one of the most dedicated public servants I’ve ever known.
 
Shame on the president for his despicable comments.

This is a sad and solemn day in our nation’s history. 

None of us came to Congress to impeach a president but President Trump, by his own actions, left us no choice. 

No one in this county is above the law, not even the president.

With the rules now adopted, the House has now begun six equally-divided hours of debate on the articles of impeachment against President Trump. 

Tune in here to watch LIVE:  https://www.c-span.org/video/?467441-1/us-house-debates-articles-impeachment … pic.twitter.com/n03VEgZ9Y7

Sitting here in the speaker’s chair, all I can think is how serious this debate is for the future of our republic.
 
The fact that I’ve been asked to preside over the House for this important moment in our nation's history is truly an honor. pic.twitter.com/Jt7x5L1DPC

Heading down to the House floor now to preside over today’s impeachment debate.
 
WATCH LIVE here: https://twitter.com/cspan/status/1207294899701374977 …

Speaker Pelosi has asked me to serve as speaker pro tempore and preside over the House for today’s impeachment debate.

This is a sad and somber moment in our nation’s history and the responsibility to preside is something I won't take lightly. https://www.denverpost.com/2019/12/18/trump-impeachment-diana-degette-congress/ …

The House Judiciary Committee just released its final report detailing President Trump’s egregious abuses of power and why he must be held accountable.

Every American should read this⤵️ https://medium.com/housejudiciary/chairman-nadler-files-judiciary-committee-impeachment-report-ahead-of-house-vote-on-impeachment-2f3eca3b58a4 …

Three years ago today our 21st Century Cures Act was signed into law. This historic bill accelerated the way our nation researches & develops new life-saving cures for the world’s deadliest diseases. Now, @RepFredUpton & I are working on Cures 2.0 to build on its success further. pic.twitter.com/r31Y4ShKz2

BREAKING: The House Judiciary Committee just approved articles of impeachment against President Trump.
 
The president abused his power, violated the public’s trust and – for the sake of our democracy – must be held accountable.

No amount of gold medals are worth putting the health and safety of our athletes at risk.
 
Read the op-ed @SenCoryGardner and I wrote today about our legislation to reform the U.S. Olympic & Paralympic Committee: http://gazette.justsharedthis.info/ZgJB1k

Heading to the House floor to cast my vote to #LowerDrugCosts NOW!
 
#HR3 is a landmark bill to lower the cost of prescription drugs for millions of Americans.
 
No one in this country should have to choose between putting food on their table and paying for their medication.

3 in 10 adults in America have reported not taking their prescribed medication because it costs too much. That’s unacceptable. And that’s why we are fighting so hard to #LowerDrugCosts NOW. pic.twitter.com/n3r85HacQJ

Tonight at 7 pm ET, the House Judiciary Committee will start debating #ArticlesOfImpeachment against the president.

Pres. Trump abused his power, put our national security at risk, & tried to cover it up.

For the sake of our republic, he must be held accountable.

Tune in here: https://twitter.com/HouseJudiciary/status/1204911349526093825 …

The version the House passed previously would have blocked money for Trump’s border wall, required congressional approval before waging war with Iran and overturned Trump’s ban on transgender troops. The version we were asked to vote on today did none of that.

I was just asked why I voted against the defense bill. While it has some good things, such as paid family leave, I’m not going to vote to give this admin a blank check to wage endless wars while millions of Americans struggle to put food on their table & pay for their medication.

NEWS: The House just approved legislation to help our farmers in Colorado and across the U.S. by providing their workers a pathway to permanent residency.

Our farmers are the lifeblood of this country. We need to be doing everything we can to help them succeed.

We have just introduced legislation to reauthorize the U.S. anti-doping agency. 

Our Olympic athletes train their entire lives for the chance to compete on the world stage. 

When they do, they deserve to have a level playing field.

This is the most egregious example of abuse of executive power for personal benefit and obstruction of Congress we’ve ever seen. https://www.denverpost.com/2019/12/10/impeachment-trump-ken-buck-joe-neguse/ …

JUST RELEASED: Here are the articles of impeachment against President Trump. 

I urge every American to read these:  https://judiciary.house.gov/sites/democrats.judiciary.house.gov/files/documents/Articles%20of%20Impeachment.pdf …

Public office is a public trust. And those who violate that trust must be held accountable. President Trump has abused his power, put our national security at risk and blocked Congress’s attempt to investigate. No one in this country is above the law, not even the president.

I’ll never forgot joining @repjohnlewis & others in Selma in 1998 to commemorate the march for equal voting rights.
 
More than 20 years later, our fight for equality continues.
 
Today, the House voted to restore voting protections gutted by SCOTUS. 

We must #RestoreTheVote. pic.twitter.com/Te22Hso0nw
New data shows a staggering increase in e-cigarette use amongst our young people in recent years. We must do more to protect our kids from the dangers of vaping. pic.twitter.com/Kx0JQINib8

If we are going to avoid the worst effects of this climate crisis, the U.S. must take drastic steps now to cut our carbon emissions. That's why I'm working to create our nation's first clean-energy standard to curb emissions & spur innovation.

Learn more: https://degette.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/degette-us-should-be-leader-in-combatting-climate-crisis …

This notion that we should sit around and wait to #ActOnClimate is absurd. 
 
I can't think of a single other time in U.S. history that we sat around waiting for countries like China, Russia, or India to do something. pic.twitter.com/nJqCmWxANi

Our founders instilled in us the sole power to impeach a president if the need were ever to arise. As some of our nation’s top constitutional law experts said yesterday, Pres. Trump has abused the power of his office and, for the sake of our republic, must be held accountable.

Coloradans receive 2.4 million robocalls A DAY! That’s ridiculous.
 
The House just voted to approve our legislation to stop these annoying calls once and for all.
 
With both chambers of Congress now on board, our bill to #StopBadRobocalls is one step closer to becoming law. pic.twitter.com/yhJzvRBfUJ

STUNNING: Three of the nation’s top constitutional law experts just told the House Judiciary Committee that, in their opinion, President Trump committed at least three impeachable offenses: bribery, abuse of power and obstruction of justice. 
 
No one is above the law.

This year’s flu season is off to the fastest start in more than a decade. And we need to be prepared.
 
At 10:30 am EST, our oversight panel will hear from top U.S. health officials about their efforts to protect the public’s health. Tune in here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UKYBbbWAa3o&feature=emb_title …

“The president placed his own personal & political interests above the national interests of the United States, sought to undermine the integrity of the U.S. presidential election process, and endangered U.S. national security.”

Read the full report here:  https://intelligence.house.gov/report/

Yesterday, I helped lead nearly 200 members of Congress in filing an amicus brief in the June v. Gee case to make clear why we believe the Court must continue to uphold our constitutionally-protected reproductive rights. 

You can read our full brief here:  https://degette.house.gov/sites/degette.house.gov/files/Amicus%20Brief.pdf …
